name: KineMaster Project File
summary: Learn about .KINE files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: In version 5, KineMaster began allowing users to export their video editing projects as KINE files. Each KINE file includes a project's KMPROJECT file, which defines how KineMaster loads the project, and all the media files used in that project. By exporting a project as a KINE file, KineMaster users can transfer projects from device to device, allowing them to edit projects across devices.

instructions:
KINE files can be opened using the KineMaster video editing software. Here are the steps to open a KINE file:

Download and install KineMaster on your device, if you haven’t already.Open the KineMaster app on your device.Tap on the “Projects” tab in the bottom right corner of the screen.Tap on the “Import” button in the top right corner.Select the KINE file you want to open from your device’s file manager or from a cloud storage service such as Google Drive or Dropbox.Once the KINE file is imported, you can edit it just like any other project in KineMaster.

Please note that KINE files can only be opened in KineMaster and cannot be opened or edited in other video editing software. If you need to share the project with someone who does not have KineMaster installed, you can export the project as a video file and share it with them.

You can open a KINE file in version 5 and above of KineMaster (Android, iOS). To do so, you must first create a new project, and then click the Import Project button. Then, navigate to and import your KINE file.
